title: setDesiredFramerate​
content: </> Behavior:setDesiredFramerate(desiredFramerate: number) → Behavior sets a desired framerate for the behavior

title: beforeStep​
content: </> Behavior:beforeStep(callback: BehaviorStepCallback) → Behavior adds a step callback scheduled to run before moving the bullet

title: afterStep​
content: </> Behavior:afterStep(callback: BehaviorStepCallback) → Behavior adds a step callback scheduled to run after moving the bullet

title: Installation​
content: flashcast is up on wally. you can install it simply by putting this in your wally.toml file Flashcast = "synpixel/flashcast@3.0.0"

title: Examples​
content: https://www.roblox.com/games/17695354946/Flashcast-Example-1https://www.roblox.com/games/17696744681/Flashcast-Example-2

title: new​
content: </> Flashcast.new(options?: FlashcastOptions) → ()
interface FlashcastOptions { worldRoot?: WorldRoot -- default: Workspace event?: RBXScriptSignal -- default: RunService.PostSimulation }  creates a new flashcast instance

title: createBehavior​
content: </> Flashcast.createBehavior() → Behavior creates a new behavior

title: getBullets​
content: </> Flashcast:getBullets() → {Bullet} gets every bullet in the instance

title: spawnBullet​
content: </> Flashcast:spawnBullet( behavior: Behavior, origin: Vector3 , direction: Vector3 , raycastParams?: RaycastParams ) → Bullet spawns a bullet with a behavior

title: step​
content: </> Flashcast:step() → () used internally to advance every bullet by one step

title: clear​
content: </> Flashcast:clear() → () clears all bullets in the instance

title: destroy​
content: </> Flashcast:destroy() → () enables the instance to be garbage collected (also clears all bullets)

title: behavior​
content: </> Bullet.behavior: Behavior

title: position​
content: </> Bullet.position: Vector3

title: direction​
content: </> Bullet.direction: Vector3

title: raycastParams?​
content: </> Bullet.raycastParams?: RaycastParams

title: distanceTraveled​
content: </> Bullet.distanceTraveled: number

title: raycastResults​
content: </> Bullet.raycastResults: {RaycastResult}

title: desiredFramerate​
content: </> Bullet.desiredFramerate: number the desired framerate which you want the bullet to move at, by default the behavior's desired framerate (you can modify this)

title: lastTick​
content: </> Bullet.lastTick: number the bullet's last resumption step

title: touched​
content: </> Bullet.touched: RaycastResult? the current RaycastResult, set every frame by flashcast

title: data​
content: </> Bullet.data: {[any]: any} empty table for state

title: move​
content: </> Bullet:move(position: Vector3 ) → () moves the bullet, raycasting from the position to the goal

title: stop​
content: </> Bullet:stop() → () stops the bullet

title: isStopped​
content: </> Bullet:isStopped() → () gets whether or not the bullet has been stopped
